title: Profitable Schemes
content:
There is a group of  members, and a list of various crimes they could commit.
The  crime generates a  and requires  members to participate in it.
If a member participates in one crime, that member can't participate in another crime.
Let's call a profitable scheme any subset of these crimes that generates at least  profit, and the total number of members participating in that subset of crimes is at most .
How many schemes can be chosen?  Since the answer may be very large, return it modulo .
